oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 36 c
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 36 c. Newspaper clipping: (fragment; continuation of 36 a and 36 b) '...be expected to cast their votes...'
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Voting;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: be expected to cast their votes as strictly partisan as will their husbands. Many of them interviewed on the streets and in the stores smilingly admit that they do not know anything at all about it. They are able to glibly recite the names of the candidates which will appear on their county ticket, but cannot tell, in many cases, what offices they seek nor who their opponents are. Yet, in seven out of ten cases, they say: "Sure. I'm going to vote. I think it's my duty. Don't you?" And the reporter agrees with them and starts seeking another interview, vainly hoping that he will find at least one women who knows what she is talking about and why.
